column13: Empowerment, communication and leadership were the focus areas of F&P Mexico's Women in Leadership Programme implemented this year. Aiming to improve female representation in senior roles in Mexico, the programme was also designed to increase women's engagement and well-being at work and home.

column13: We nurture a collaborative, open, diverse, honest and inclusive culture to achieve our company purpose. To develop this environment, we are committed to embedding Diversity, Equity and Inclusion in everything we do. This approach is critical to achieving long-term, sustainable improvement.\t

column13: In the 2023 financial year, Fisher & Paykel Healthcare became a support partner of New Zealand's Global Women organisation and its Champions for Change group. Our Board Chair, Scott St John, will participate alongside over 80 senior business leaders committed to achieving four drivers of inclusive and diverse workplaces: increasing gender diversity, increasing MÃÂori and ethnic diversity, leading inclusive cultures, and influencing the outside world.

column9: IDEA Council (Inclusion, Diversity, Equity and Awareness Council)
column13: The IDEA Council is a trusted advisor to the executive leadership team and Board and ensures sustainable, equitable outcomes from diversity and inclusion initiatives. With the demands of the pandemic easing, the council was able to concentrate on measures to include employees from manufacturing and operations teams to participate in DEI projects.

The project has started to scope two projects: Visibility of Role Models, R&Dversity and Women in Engineering (WiEng), and a Pilot Model Shop Training programme, identifying five specific points to embed into existing company projects.

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: Women in Engineering group exists to support and empower a community of over 150 women in technical roles through personal and professional growth opportunities and offer mentoring to aspiring young engineers at high school and university. WiEng and our learning and development team created a three-part series of workshops that included the basics of mentoring, preparing for a good mentoring relationship, panels of experienced people-leaders from our research and development teams, and a speed networking session. \t

column9: Hei Oranga Hinengaro Ã¢ÂÂ Mental Wellbeing Champion Network
column13: The Hei Oranga Hinengaro Mental Well-being Champion Network is designed to be informal, authentic and accessible. The purpose of the network is to empower our people to help each other by enabling conversations about mental well-being and supporting them to find help. A pilot for the network has been set up in the New Zealand manufacturing area, with 50 employees signed up for training.
column20: Mental health, employee well-being, peer support networks
